column4: im trying to get some data off an ntfs partition.. any idea what would be the easiest way to do this? (i dont have the admin password for the xp install)
so i should just boot off an ubuntu disk and do that?
the ntfs partition is on same disk than ubuntu?
no, i dont have ubuntu installed anywhere..
so I didnt get your problem, hehe
i have 2 pc's both are windows xp. im trying to backup the data from them and reformat them
so, i dont really need an ubuntu disk then?
yes, but we dont have the password
as I said... the chntpwd will allow you to change the Adm password
i googled chntpwd... cant realy find a good download link for it.
wait a second... I'll check if I have it here
sorry... I told you the wrong name
sorry... did you read the url?
i got the link, yea. im just burning an ubuntu disk now. going to try that.
